content.title: Klippel-Trenaunay Syndrome

definition.primary: A rare congenital vascular malformation syndrome characterized by the clinical triad of capillary malformations (port-wine stain), venous malformations and varicosities, and limb hypertrophy affecting one or more extremities, typically a lower limb.
key_concepts: Triad: capillary malformation + venous anomalies + limb hypertrophy
PIK3CA gene mutations identified in affected tissue
Distinguish from Parkes Weber syndrome (has significant arteriovenous component)

epidemiology.inheritance: Usually sporadic; rare familial cases reported

molecular_basis.pathway: PI3K/AKT/mTOR pathway dysregulation leading to abnormal vascular and tissue growth

capillary_malformation.distribution: Usually corresponding to affected limb, may extend to trunk
capillary_malformation.evolution: Present at birth, may darken with age

superficial: Lateral marginal vein of Servelle (embryonic lateral vein persistence)

limb_hypertrophy.type: Combined bone and soft tissue overgrowth
limb_hypertrophy.distribution: Usually unilateral, lower extremity most common
limb_hypertrophy.progression: Progressive through childhood, stabilizes after puberty
limb_hypertrophy.complications: Leg length discrepancy, joint problems, functional impairment

parkes_weber_syndrome.clinical_clue: Bruit, thrill, increased warmth, high-output cardiac failure possible

differential_diagnosis.sturge_weber: Facial port-wine stain with intracranial involvement
differential_diagnosis.proteus_syndrome: Progressive asymmetric overgrowth, cerebriform connective tissue nevi

clinical_criteria.required: Two of the three classic features (capillary malformation, venous anomalies, limb hypertrophy)
clinical_criteria.supportive: Lateral marginal vein, deep venous anomalies, lymphatic involvement

imaging.purpose: Evaluate extent of vascular malformations, deep venous anatomy
imaging.findings: Venous malformations, deep venous hypoplasia, soft tissue hypertrophy

imaging.purpose: Assess deep venous patency before any intervention
imaging.critical: Must confirm deep venous system adequacy before superficial ablation

imaging.purpose: Comprehensive venous anatomy, especially for surgical planning
Quantify leg length discrepancy, bone age assessment

diagnosis.genetic_testing: PIK3CA mutation analysis may confirm diagnosis in ambiguous cases

management.multidisciplinary_approach: Essential - involves vascular surgery, dermatology, orthopedics, interventional radiology, physical therapy

compression_therapy.rationale: Cornerstone of management for venous insufficiency
compression_therapy.considerations: Custom-fitted garments, may be challenging due to limb shape

venous_interventions.critical_principle: Never ablate superficial veins if they provide sole drainage (deep system absent or hypoplastic)
venous_interventions.sclerotherapy: For isolated venous malformations, venous blebs

surgical_options.indication: Only if deep system adequate, symptomatic varicosities
Severe soft tissue overgrowth causing functional impairment
Predicted significant leg length discrepancy (> 2 cm)

sirolimus.evidence: Case reports/series showing benefit in severe cases

medical_therapy.anticoagulation: For recurrent thrombosis or pulmonary embolism

complications_management.vte: High risk due to venous anomalies, low-flow states
complications_management.dic_localized: Localized intravascular coagulopathy in large malformations

prognosis.natural_history: Chronic, progressive through childhood, typically stabilizes in adulthood
prognosis.life_expectancy: Normal in most cases with appropriate management
prognosis.quality_of_life: Can be significantly impacted by pain, cosmesis, functional limitations

content.statement: Klippel-Trenaunay Syndrome is a fundamental concept in Health-Sciences Medicine Surgery Vascular Pathology Rare-Syndromes that provides essential knowledge for understanding related topics and clinical/practical applications.

explanation.key_insight: The key aspects of Klippel-Trenaunay Syndrome include core principles, common applications, and integration with related concepts.
explanation.technical_details: Technical details involve specific mechanisms, measurements, and evidence-based applications of Klippel-Trenaunay Syndrome.

learning_objectives: Recognize the clinical triad of Klippel-Trenaunay syndrome
Distinguish from Parkes Weber syndrome (high-flow component)
Understand the importance of deep venous assessment before intervention
Recognize the role of PIK3CA mutations and mTOR inhibitors
key_points: Classic triad: port-wine stain, venous anomalies, limb hypertrophy
Deep venous system is often hypoplastic or absent
Never ablate superficial veins without confirming adequate deep drainage
Sirolimus may be beneficial in severe cases
clinical_pearls: Lateral marginal vein of Servelle is pathognomonic but not always present
High VTE risk - consider prophylaxis during surgery/immobilization
GI venous malformations can cause chronic bleeding
Parkes Weber has a bruit/thrill - KTS does not (low-flow)

references.evidence_basis: Case series, consensus guidelines, molecular studies
